title: Spoke Roadmap to Mainstream Adoption
description:
Transform Spoke from POC/Alpha to production-ready, enterprise-grade protobuf schema registry competing with Buf.build, Confluent Schema Registry, and AWS Glue Schema Registry.

**Current State:**
- Core schema storage and versioning ✅
- Basic CLI tooling ✅
- Filesystem storage ✅
- Go and Python compilation ✅
- No authentication or security ❌
- No scalable storage backend ❌
- No breaking change detection ❌
- No documentation generation ❌
- Limited to 2 programming languages ❌

**Competitive Position:**
- Buf.build is 5+ years ahead in features and ecosystem
- Best positioning: Open-source alternative to buf.build for self-hosted, privacy-first deployments
- Unique value: Cost-effective, cloud-agnostic, community-driven

**Success Metrics:**
- Phase 1 (6 months): 100 GitHub stars, 10 production deployments
- Phase 2 (12 months): 500 GitHub stars, 50 production deployments, 5 enterprise customers, 99.9% SLA
- Phase 3 (18-24 months): 2,000 GitHub stars, 200 production deployments, 25 enterprise customers, k ARR

**Total Effort:** 18-24 months to feature parity with Buf.build

title: Phase 1: Production-Ready (6 months)
description:
Make Spoke safe and viable for production use

**Goal:** Production-ready release with security, scalable storage, governance, observability, and CI/CD integration

**Timeline:** Q1-Q2 2026 (6 months)

**Deliverables:**
- Spoke v1.0.0: Production-ready release
- Security: Authentication + RBAC
- Storage: PostgreSQL + S3 + Redis
- Governance: Breaking change detection
- Observability: Metrics + logs + health checks
- Integration: GitHub Actions + GitLab CI

**Target Users:** Small-to-medium engineering teams (10-100 developers)

**Success Metrics:**
- 100 GitHub stars
- 10 production deployments
- 5 external contributors
- 0 critical security vulnerabilities
- < 100ms p99 API latency
- Documentation coverage > 80%

title: Authentication System
description:
Implement API token authentication, basic RBAC, bot users for CI/CD, and rate limiting

**Priority:** P0 (Blocker)
**Effort:** 8 weeks
**Timeline:** Q1 2026

**Requirements:**
- API token authentication (Bearer tokens)
- Bot users for CI/CD automation
- Basic RBAC (admin, developer, viewer roles)
- Organization-level roles
- Module-level permissions (read, write, delete)
- Team-based access control
- Rate limiting per user/organization
- Audit logging for all schema operations
- IP allowlisting for enterprise security

**Competitor Reference:**
- Buf.build: Token auth, SSO (SAML/OAuth2), bot users, org-level RBAC
- Confluent: API key auth, RBAC, audit logs
- AWS Glue: IAM integration, resource-based policies

**Impact:** Blocks ANY production deployment - currently all endpoints completely open

title: Database Backend
description:
Implement scalable storage backend with PostgreSQL for metadata, S3 for artifacts, and Redis for caching

**Priority:** P0 (Blocker)
**Effort:** 8 weeks
**Timeline:** Q1 2026

**Requirements:**

**Metadata Storage:**
- PostgreSQL backend for modules/versions/metadata
- MySQL support as alternative
- Schema migration system (goose, migrate)
- Connection pooling and failover

**Artifact Storage:**
- S3-compatible object storage (AWS S3, MinIO, GCS, Azure Blob)
- Multi-region replication
- Lifecycle policies for old versions
- Content-addressable storage (deduplication)

**Caching Layer:**
- Redis for frequently accessed schemas
- Cache invalidation strategies
- TTL-based expiration
- Multi-level caching (L1: in-memory, L2: Redis)

**Storage Abstraction:**
- Interface-based design (already exists)
- Pluggable storage drivers
- Configuration-based backend selection
- Migration tools between backends

**Impact:** Cannot scale beyond single node, no HA, no cloud-native deployment

**Architecture:**
API Servers (N nodes, stateless, horizontally scaled) -> PostgreSQL (metadata) + Redis (cache) -> S3/Object Storage (proto files, artifacts)

title: Breaking Change Detection
description:
Implement wire-level and source-level compatibility checking with multiple compatibility modes

**Priority:** P0 (Production blocker)
**Effort:** 6 weeks
**Timeline:** Q1 2026

**Requirements:**

**Wire-level compatibility checking:**
- Binary encoding analysis
- Field number conflicts
- Type compatibility (int32 ↔ int64, etc.)
- Enum value additions/removals

**Source-level compatibility checking:**
- Field additions/removals
- Field renames
- Package/namespace changes
- Import path changes

**Compatibility Modes:**
- BACKWARD: New schema can read old data
- FORWARD: Old schema can read new data
- FULL: Both backward and forward compatible
- NONE: No compatibility checking
- Per-module configuration

**Breaking Change Gates:**
- API endpoint to check compatibility before push
- CLI command: spoke check-compatibility
- CI/CD integration (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI)
- Approval workflow for breaking changes
- Override mechanism with justification

**Change Detection Algorithm:**
- Parse proto AST (already have parser)
- Build schema graph
- Compare field numbers, types, names
- Detect removed fields, changed types
- Generate human-readable diff

**API Examples:**
CLI: spoke push --check-compatibility-mode=FULL
API: POST /modules/{name}/versions/{version}/check-compatibility

**Impact:** Cannot prevent breaking changes, no schema governance

title: Documentation Generation
description:
Auto-generate HTML documentation from proto comments with interactive features and version history

**Priority:** P1
**Effort:** 6 weeks
**Timeline:** Q2 2026

**Requirements:**

**Documentation Site Generation:**
- HTML documentation from proto comments
- Markdown export option
- PDF generation for offline docs
- Versioned documentation (per version)
- Search functionality

**Interactive Features:**
- Message/service browsing
- Field-level documentation
- Type cross-references
- Dependency graph visualization
- Example usage generation

**Change History:**
- Version-to-version diff view
- Change log generation
- Field deprecation tracking
- Migration guides

**API Reference:**
- Service method documentation
- Request/response schemas
- Error codes and handling
- Authentication requirements
- Rate limiting info

**UI Features:**
- Search schemas
- Browse messages and services
- Display field documentation
- Show usage relationships (Used By: other services)

**Impact:** Poor API discoverability, low developer adoption
